title: Pakistan, Turkiye vow to strengthen trade, defence ties
content:
ISTANBUL, Nov 3 (APP): Pakistan and Turkiye on Monday expressing satisfaction over the positive trajectory of Pakistan-Turkiye bilateral relations, reaffirmed their shared commitment to further deepening cooperation across political, economic, and defence spheres.

The bilateral ties and cooperation were discussed in a bilateral meeting between Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Senator Muhammad Ishaq Dar and Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan, on the sidelines of Ministerial Meeting on Gaza being held here.

Both sides agreed to continue working together on the issue of Palestine, especially establishing sustainable peace in Gaza.

They reaffirmed the strong bonds of brotherhood and mutual support that continue to underpin the Pakistan-Turkiye relations and agreed to maintain close coordination on regional and international issues.
